qas.question: Who went to war against Bolshevick armies?

answers.text: guerrillas throughout Central Asia, known as basmachi

qas.question: What did they go to war against Bolshevick?

context: After the Russian Revolution of 1917 <a0_0><b7_0>guerrillas<b7_0/> throughout Central Asia, known as <b4_0>basmachi<b4_0/><a0_0/>, waged a war against Bolshevik armies in a futile attempt <a1_0>to maintain independence<a1_0/>. <a2_0>The Bolsheviks<a2_0/> prevailed after a four-year war, in which mosques and villages were burned down and the population heavily suppressed. Soviet authorities started a campaign of secularization, practicing <a3_0><b5_0>Islam, Judaism, and Christianity<b5_0/><a3_0/> was discouraged and repressed, and many <b8_0>mosques, churches, and synagogues<b8_0/> were closed. As a consequence of the conflict and Soviet agriculture policies, <b6_0>Central Asia<b6_0/>, Tajikistan included, suffered a famine that claimed many lives.
